title: Chargers standout RB says he’ll play vs. Patriots after missing practice time due to injury
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots Chargers running back Omarion Hampton is one of six players the team ruled as questionable for Sunday's game against the Patriots.
Chargers running back Omarion Hampton has missed several games due to a pair of ankle injuries this season.

(AP Photo/William Liang) By Conor Roche January 9, 2026 | 4:22 PM 1 minute to read The Chargers’ offensive front is pretty banged up, but it appears they’ll get one of their top playmakers back for Sunday’s wild-card game against the Patriots.

title: Rumored Red Sox target Ketel Marte reportedly won’t be traded. What does it mean for Boston’s Alex Bregman pursuit?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Diamondbacks have been rumored as a potential landing spot for Bregman.
Ketel Marte had been rumored as a potential trade target for the Red Sox after two straight All-Star seasons with the Diamondbacks.

(AP Photo/Rick Scuteri) By Conor Roche January 9, 2026 | 4:01 PM 2 minutes to read The Red Sox can cross another big-name bat off their list of offseason targets, but it could help their chances of retaining Alex Bregman.

title: Scituate man sentenced in animal torture videos case
author: Shannon Murphy
bullets: Crime The man and others directed and sent money to individuals in Indonesia to create videos "depicting violent torture of baby and adult monkeys," officials said.

By Shannon Murphy updated on January 9, 2026 | 3:28 PM 1 minute to read A Massachusetts man was sentenced in federal court Thursday for his role in creating and distributing videos “depicting acts of extreme violence and sexual abuse against animals,” officials said.

Garrett Fitzgerald, of Scituate, was sentenced to 30 months in prison, three years of supervised release, and 100 hours of community service after pleading guilty to conspiring to create and distribute the so-called “animal crush videos,” federal authorities said.

title: More people in Mass. are enrolling in the insurance of last resort — why?
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Real Estate Climate change and increased costs are driving more homeowners to seek coverage through the FAIR Plan.
Homes along the coast are more likely to not be offered coverage by traditional home insurers.
David L.

title: What is the Safe Communities Act, and how could it limit ICE activity in Mass.?
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The fatal shooting in Minnesota is becoming a national flashpoint that could spur change in Massachusetts.
Several hundred people protested in downtown Boston after the killing of a woman by an ICE officer in Minneapolis this week.
Ken McGagh for The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: TreVeyon Henderson misses Patriots’ final practice ahead of Chargers game, but expected to play
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots Henderson missed the Patriots' final practice of the week due to personal reasons.
TreVeyon Henderson was the Patriots' leading rusher in the regular season.

title: Boston area native identified as victim in 1982 Ohio pedestrian crash
author: Shannon Murphy
bullets: Local News Charles Joseph Nunnenman III was born in Waltham in 1941 and grew up in the Boston area.
Charles Joseph Nunnenman III.

– via DNA Doe ProjectA man killed in a pedestrian crash in Boardman, Ohio, has been identified after over 40 years, thanks to the DNA Doe Project, a volunteer organization that works to identify John and Jane Does.

title: Man pleads guilty to killing Concord resident with his car while driving distracted, avoids jail time
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Joshua Quimby, 35, pleaded guilty to killing 53-year-old pedestrian Tamar Vishlitzky in a 2024 Bedford crash.
By Abby Patkin January 9, 2026 | 1:35 PM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A Billerica man was ordered to give up his driver’s license for 15 years and perform 100 hours of community service after he pleaded guilty to killing a Concord woman with his car in 2024.
